sentence.idiomatic: These Fuwa are very cute.
Do you know where the Fuwa are for sale?
I like this Fuwa.
Do you know what the mascot of this year’s World Cup is?
The Beijing Olympic Games mascots are very cute.
This is my good luck charm. It brings good luck to me.
His performance was truly perfect.
Do you think there is perfect love in the world?
Only she could design such perfect clothing.
In our studies, we need to combine theory and application.
This song combines the characteristics of classical music with rock music.
We should incorporate real-life situations into our work.
There is really no creativity in this advertisement.
Good creativity is the key to success.
We don’t want works lacking in creativity.
What do you think of his new style?
The style of these mascots is very cute.
This type of style doesn’t suit her at all.
We all hope our home countries will be prosperous and strong.
A country‘s stability provides an important safeguard for economic prosperity.
The small commodity economy here is extremely prosperous.

word.literal: to be unable to stop oneself from

sentence.idiomatic: Hearing this news, she couldn’t help crying.
Seeing such a splendid performance, everyone couldn’t help applauding.

word.literal: to be unable to stop from

sentence.idiomatic: Every evening, I can’t help but think of him.
People and nature should get along together harmoniously.
Economic development can only be promoted if there is a harmonious social environment.
Building a harmonious society takes everyone’s joint effort.
Oh my! You have the Fuwa? They’re the mascots for the Beijing Olympics, right? They really are so cute!
Yeah. These five Fuwa perfectly combine traditional Chinese culture with the Olympic culture.
Oh right, I’ve heard that their names are very interesting.
Exactly. Their names are “Beibei,” “Jingjing,” “Huanhuan,” “Yingying,” and “Nini.” When you put them together it sounds like “Beijing welcomes you.”
It really does. How creative!

word.literal: to be or not to be

sentence.idiomatic: Look again at the styling of the Fuwa. Isn’t it interesting?
Uh-huh. In their bodies we can clearly make out the figures of a fish, a panda, a Tibetan antelope, a swallow, and the Olympic flame.

These five figures also each separately represent a different meaning. Take for example, Beibei, the fish-shaped Fuwa. It symbolizes prosperity. This is because in traditional Chinese culture, fish symbolize prosperity.
I didn’t realize these little Fuwa could represent such rich meaning. I can’t help but to bring them home with me.
Ha ha. These five Fuwa also symbolize that people, animals, and nature need to live in harmony. This is also one of the important themes of the Beijing Olympics.

word.literal: can’t help but, can’t keep from
